questions.text: Most important gene for testis formation among these are
questions.solution: Reference: Williams Obstetrics 4th/ed, pg no 57

questions.text: The cut of FSH level for diagnosis of Premature ovarian failure
questions.solution:
• If gonadotropins are elevated into the menopausal range (typically, basal FSH levels will be greater than 30-40 mIU/mL, depending on the laboratory used), a repeat FSH measurement is indicated in 1 month.
  • If the result indicates that FSH is elevated, a diagnosis of primary ovarian insufficiency can be established.

Reference: ACOG guidelines, 2017.

questions.text: Development of which of the following structures are not affected due to mullerian anomalies
questions.solution:
• The Mullerian ducts will ultimately form the uterine or fallopian tubes, uterus, cervix, and proximal third of the vagina in females.

Reference: Williams Obstetrics 4th/ed, pg no 58

questions.text: Identify the instrument that is shown here
questions.solution:
• Leech Wilkinson Cannula is an instrument commonly used for manipulating the uterus. It is often used during numerous gynaecological procedures.
  • Has an extended tip with a wide end for precise uterine manipulation.
  • Transfers gas and fluid inside the uterus, therefore relieving tubal blockage under pressure.

Reference: D.C Dutta's textbook of obsgtetrics, 10th/ed pg no 433

questions.text: When should the gonadectomy be performed in a patient with Androgen Insensitivity syndrome?
questions.solution:
People with AIS have one X and one Y chromosome. Their gonads develop as testicles. Their testicles make hormones called androgens including testosterone.

Complete androgen insensitivity syndrome is treated with estrogen replacement therapy after puberty.

  • Undescended testicles will be surgically removed because of the risk that they will become cancerous.
  • Treatment for partial androgen insensitivity syndrome may include corrective surgery to match gender identity.

Reference: Williams gynecology 4th/ed, pg no 158

Now patient complaints of passage of urine from vagina, and On methylene blue dye test middle swab is wet and stained with methylene blue dye. Which among the following is the most likely cause?
questions.solution:

questions.text: Identify the type of cell shown below
questions.solution:
• A Pap smear dominated by intermediate cells is characteristic of late luteal and early follicular phases of the cycle.
  • Predominance of superficial cells is at the time of ovulation.
  • Parabasal cells predominance indicates thin and atrophic epithelium.

Reference: Williams Gynecology 4th/ed, pg no 418

questions.text: 1st LN involved in carcinoma cervix
questions.solution:
In cervical cancer patients with only 1 positive lymph node, this node is most frequently located within the external iliac and obturator regions and the parametrium.

Sentinel node identification should primarily address these lymph node sites.

Reference: Williams Gynecology 4th/ed, pg no 518

questions.text: The production of cervical muscus is initiated by
questions.solution:
The rise in estradiol prior to ovulation supports the secretion of increasing quantity and estrogenic quality of cervical mucus, and the subsequent rise in progesterone after ovulation causes an abrupt decrease in mucus secretion.

Reference: D.C Dutta's textbook of obsgtetrics, 10th/ed pg no 23

questions.text: A 25yr old lady, with known case of PCOD, is distressed due to hirsutism. Which of the following is the best treatment in this scenario-
questions.solution:
• It is a 4th generation OCPill.
  • Combined oral contraceptives are first-line therapy for women with hirsutism who are not trying to conceive and in whom cosmetic measures are ineffective.
  • If patient-important hirsutism persists after six months of therapy with combined oral contraceptives, the addition of an antiandrogen should be considered.

Reference: D.C Dutta's textbook of gynecology, 10th/ed pg no 323

questions.text: Most common cause of ambiguous genitalia
questions.solution:
Congenital adrenal hyperplasia is the most common cause of ambigeneous genitalia.

Reference: Williams Gynecology 4th/ed, pg no 128

questions.text: The sequence of development of puberty in girls is
questions.solution: Reference: Williams Gynecology 4th/ed, pg no 28

questions.text: Whiff test is positive in
questions.solution:
The whiff test is a test for the fishy odor that occurs in bacterial vaginosis (previously called Gardnerella vaginitis and nonspecific vaginitis).

A drop of KOH is mixed with some vaginal discharge. A positive test is abnormal and consists of a characteristic fishy odor.

Also called amine test.

Reference: Williams Gynecology 4th/ed, pg no 328

questions.text: Postpartum VVF is best repaired after
questions.solution:
• Surgical repair is the classic treatment for a UVF and most surgeons repair the VVF at least 3 months after the injury, when tissue healing is complete.
  • The only way to fix vesicovaginal fistulas is with surgery to close off the opening.
  • Sometimes additional procedures are needed to correct the original cause of the problem, such as damage to the bladder.

Reference: Williams Gynecology 4th/ed, pg no 348

questions.text: Anterior colporrhaphy and post colpoperineorrhaphy is known as
questions.solution:
Colporrhaphy is a surgery used to repair weaknesses in your vaginal walls that are causing unpleasant symptoms.

Anterior colporrhaphy is plication of fibromuscular layer of vagina to reduce prolapse and support bladder.

Posterior colpoperineorrhaphy is plication of fibromus-cular layer with inclusion of levator ani and repair of introitus by plication of superficial muscles to perineal body.

Reference: Williams Gynecology 4th/ed, pg no 348

questions.text: 33yr old female, suffering from infertility is planned for endometrial biopsy. What is the right time in her menstural cycle to do endometrial biopsy?
questions.solution:
The endometrial biopsy is generally performed between days 6-12 of your menstrual cycle.

By performing the procedure following menses and before ovulation, we will decrease the possibility of including an early pregnancy in the biopsy specimen.

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 67.

questions.text: In azoospermia, the test that can differentiate between testicular failure and obstruction of vas deferent is
questions.solution: Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 356.

questions.text: Best prognosis for reversibility is seen with which for the following re-anastomosis after Tubal sterilisation-
questions.solution:
• It demonstrates that better pregnancy rates are achieved where mechanical sterilization techniques have resulted in only short lengths of tubal destruction.
  • Isthmo-isthmic anastomoses have the most favourable outcome.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 456

choices.text: Pain starts after 2-3days before mensturation and ends after day of mensturation
Pain starts few hours before mensturation and may last for 48-72hrs
May b associated with psychological factors
GnRH antagonist are used as 1st line treatment

questions.text: True about primary dysmenorrhea -
questions.solution: Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 256

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman visits GOPD with/o intermenstrual bleeding. The USG image shows lesion with in endometrial cavity with feeding vessel. Diagnosis is
questions.solution:
Endometrial polyps refer to overgrowths of endometrial glands and stroma within the uterine cavity.

Endometrial polyps vary in size from a few millimeters to several centimeters in diameter.

Polyps may be found as a single lesion or multiple lesions filling the entire endometrial cavity.

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 457

questions.text: Hypothalamic amenorrhea is seen in
questions.solution:
• Hypothalamic amenorrhea.
  • Low body weight.
  • Low percentage of body fat.
  • Very low intake of calories or fat.
  • Emotional stress.
  • Strenuous exercise that burns more calories than are taken in through food.
  • Deficiency of leptin, a protein hormone that regulates appetite and metabolism.
  • Some medical conditions or illnesses.
  • Kallman syndrome

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 157

questions.text: Stage of endometrial cancer which involves half of myometrium
questions.solution: Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 457

questions.text: Most common route of spread of endometrial cancer
questions.solution:
Endometrial cancer

Mods:

  1. Direct (m/c)
  2. Lympho vascular
  3. Trans tubal

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 458

questions.text: HPV associated with squamous cell cancer of cervix is ?
questions.solution:
• In cervical cancer, multiple HPV infections are present in approximately 8% of cases.
  • In most cases, co-infections are represented by HPV genotypes 16 and 18. Multiple HPV infections in adenocarcinomas appear slightly lower than in the squamous counterpart.
  • Three HPV genotypes, HPV 16, 18, and 45, dominated in all adenocarcinomas and together accounted for 94.1% of HPV-positive tumors.
  • HPV16 was the most common and found in 50.9% of HPV-positive cases, followed by HPV18 (31.6%) and HPV45 (11.6%).

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 456

questions.text: In a patient diagnosed with Stage II b cervical cancer, What is the best line of management -
questions.solution: Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 466

questions.text: Most common ovarian tumor diagnosed during pregnancy is -
2nd most common vulval cancer is
questions.solution:
Dermoid Cyst Causes

  • Dermoid cysts are caused when skin and skin structures become trapped during development fetal. Their cell walls are nearly identical to those of the outer skin and may contain multiple skin structures such as hair and sometimes hair, teeth follicles, sweat glands, or nerves.
  • Dermoid cysts (teratomas) are one of the most common types of cysts found in females between age 20 and 40 years. A dermoid cyst is made up ovarian "germ cells" and can contain teeth, hair, or fat. Most dermoid cysts are benign, but rarely, they can be cancerous.
  • Left untreated, most dermoid cysts enlarge slowly over time. Therefore, our doctors usually recommend surgical removal upon diagnosis. Completely removing the cyst is necessary to prevent infection.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 366

questions.text: Side effects of clomiphene citrate includes all except
questions.solution:
Clomiphene Citrate side effects

  • Flushing (extremely common)
  • Ovulation pain and increased sensitivity - also called "mittelschmerz".
  • Blurry vision, double vision or 'traces', (a complication which may cause treatment to be discontinued)
  • Moodiness (requiring discontinuation in severe cases)
  • Nausea
  • Breast tenderness.
  • Headache.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 266

questions.text: According to FG score, hisruitism is diagnosed when the score more than
questions.solution:
• The Ferriman-Gallwey score is used to evaluate hirsutism. The examiner scored the subjects on a scale of 0-4 for terminal hair growth on eleven different body areas according to the Ferriman-Gallwey scoring system.
  • An Ferriman-Gallwey score of 8 or more was considered diagnostic of hirsutism.

questions.text: Histological pattern that is shown in this image is
questions.solution: Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 136

questions.text: A patient who has infertility for 2yr attends the clinic. she has 28day regular menstural cycle. Day 21 progesterone level is 30ng/ml. The semen analysis's normal. Which of the following investigation should be performed on her?
questions.solution: Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 436

questions.text: Presence call Exner body in a ovarian tumor is suggestive of
questions.solution:
Call-Exner bodies of ovarian follicles have been described as "a ring of granulosa cells disposed radially around a central cavity filled with fluid and showing histochemical reactions similar to the liquor folliculi [follicular fluid]".

Seen in Grenulosa cell tumors.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 536

questions.text: All the following muscles are components of Levator Ani except
questions.solution:
The levator ani muscle, also known as the pelvic diaphragm, is a broad muscle group that forms the greater part of the floor of the pelvic cavity. It is composed of three striated muscles on each side: the iliococcygeus, pubococcygeus, and the puborectalis muscles.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 36

questions.text: Vaginal epithelium is derived from
questions.solution:
The developmental origin of vaginal epithelium has been controversial for nearly a century, with speculation that vaginal epithelium originates from the Müllerian duct, Wolffian duct, and/or urogenital sinus.

MAJOR CONCEDERATION GOES TOWARDS THE ENDODERM OF UROGENITAL SINUS.

Reference: Williams gynecology, 4th ed, pg no 26

questions.text: Vault prolapse is a potential complication after vaginal hysterectomy. Which of the following surgical procedures is specifically employed during a vaginal hysterectomy to prevent this complication?
questions.solution:
• McCall culdoplasty is a commonly performed procedure for pelvic organ prolapse surgical repair.
  • Is a relatively simple procedure that is performed after the removal of the uterus and cervix from the apex of the vagina, where the angles of the vagina are attached to their respective uterosacral ligaments, and the cul de-sac is surgically obliterated for support postoperatively.

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 358

questions.text: A 12-year-old young girl presents in the casualty with acute pain in the lower abdomen. She has history of cyclical pain for the last 5 months and she has not attained her menarche yet. On local genital examination, a tense bulge in the region of hymen was seen. The most probable diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
A condition in which the hymen fails to open up and therefore completely covers the opening to the vagina, blocking menstrual blood and secretions from flowing out Treatment options for an imperforate hymen include: Hymenectomy using cruciate or annular incisions

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 58

questions.text: A 26-year-old with married life of 2 year visits infertility clinic. She was put on HMG. On treatment, she developed dyspnea, abdominal pain. Her USG reports shows following image. What is the condition called
questions.solution:
PCOD stands for Poly Cystic Ovary Disease. The condition affects the ovaries in women by causing cysts.

This leads to a hormonal imbalance with the body producing more male hormones than needed. The hormonal imbalance leads to problems in menstruation and fertility apart from other.

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 398

choices.text: LNG 0.75mg stat followed by repeat dose after 24hr

questions.text: Which among the following method is used for emergency contraception?
questions.solution:
Ulipristal 30 mg is a prescription-only emergency contraceptive. It is at least as effective as levonorgestrel when administered within 72 hours of unprotected sexual intercourse, and is more effective than levonorgestrel in the 72- to 120-hour window.

Levonorgestrel, also known as the morning after pill, is a first-line oral emergency contraceptive pill with approval from the World Health Organization to prevent pregnancy.

It is FDA-approved to be used within 72 hours of unprotected sexual intercourse or when a presumed contraceptive failure has occurred.

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 358

questions.text: Identify the image
questions.solution:
Hydrosalpinx is a condition where fluid accumulates in one or both fallopian tubes, creating a blockage.

Hydrosalpinx causes include:

  • Previous untreated sexually transmitted infections (STIs), like chlamydia and gonorrhea.
  • Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID), oftentimes resulting from untreated STIs.
  • Scar tissue left over from pelvic surgery, especially surgery on your fallopian tubes.
  • Tissue build-up from endometriosis.

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 258

questions.text: Daughter of a woman who received DES during pregnancy is at higher risk for which of the following complications?
questions.solution:
• Prenatal (while in the womb, or in utero) DES exposure to a type of cancer of the cervix and vagina called clear cell adenocarcinoma in a small group of women.
  • Diethylstilbestrol (DES), was prescribed to millions of pregnant women from 1938 to 1971 to help prevent pregnancy complications.
  • In the late 1960s, doctors realized that there was a strong association between in utero exposure to DES and the incidence of rare vaginal and cervical cancer in young women and girls.

Reference: DC Datta text book of gynecology, 10th ed, pg no 458

questions.solution:
